text: An election to Sligo County Council took place on 27 June 1991 as part of that year's Irish local elections. 25 councillors were elected from five electoral divisions by PR-STV voting for a five-year term of office. ==Results by party== {| class=wikitable ! colspan=2 align=center|Party ! valign=top|Seats ! valign=top|± ! valign=top|First Pref. votes ! valign=top|FPv% ! valign=top|±% |- | align=right|11 | align=right|- | align=right|11,858 | align=right|44.43% | align=right| |- | align=right|11 | align=right|- | align=right|9,151 | align=right|34.29% | align=right| |- | align=right|1 | align=right|- | align=right|1,456 | align=right|5.46% | align=right| |- | align=right|2 | align=right|-1 | align=right|2,642 | align=right|9.90% | align=right| |- | align=right|0 | align=right|-1 | align=right|894 | align=right|3.35% | align=right| |- | colspan=2 align=center|Totals | align=right |25 | align=center|- | align=right |26,689 | align=center|100% | align=center|— |} ==Results by Electoral Area== ===Ballymote=== ===Dromore=== ===Drumcliffe=== ===Sligo=== ===Tubbercurry=== ==External links== *Official website Category:1991 Irish local elections 1991
title: 1991 Sligo County Council election
